subject: RE: [junit] Error on TestCase subclass in Eclipse 1.0
msgSnippet: You need to provide one with a String argument public MyTestCase(String title){ super(title); } ... http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/
messageBody:
You need to provide one with a String argument

public MyTestCase(String title){
super(title);
}

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Mark Tucker [mailto:mtucker@...]
> Sent: maandag 18 maart 2002 17:19
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Error on TestCase subclass in Eclipse 1.0
>
>
>
> I am using Eclipse 1.0 with JUnit, but when I create my
> TestCase subclass, I get an error on that line that states:
>
> "The constructor junit.framework.TestCase() is not visible"
>
> I am using JUnit 3.7.
>
> Here is my code:
>
>
> package junit.samples.money;
>
> import junit.framework.TestCase;
>
> public class MyTestCase extends TestCase {
>
> }
>
>
> A more detailed dump of the error is:
>
> java.lang.Error: Unresolved compilation problem:
> The constructor junit.framework.TestCase() is not visible
>
> at java.lang.reflect.Constructor.newInstance(Native Method)
> at junit.samples.money.MyTestCase.<init>(MyTestCase.java:5)
> at java.lang.Class.newInstance0(Native Method)
> at java.lang.Class.newInstance(Unknown Source)
> at
> org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.getTest
> (RemoteTestRunner.java:145)
> at
> org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.getTest
> (RemoteTestRunner.java:134)
> at
> org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.runTest
> s(RemoteTestRunner.java:187)
> at
> org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.run(Rem
> oteTestRunner.java:116)
> at
> org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.main(Re
> moteTestRunner.java:68)
>
>
> Thanks,
>
> Mark
